titleStmt.title: Thomas Wood to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7102

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Leabnen Ky Octobr 4 /65
Gov Thomas E Bramlett

Sir I hav this day maild 2 pettiens with 2 dollars in each for your consideratien if it is consistent with your feeling Pleas Remit these fines against William J Wood & William E Grider William J Wood is my son & has searvd 12 months in the 13 Ridgment & was a good soldier willim E grider is a soldier in my my compney of state troops & is a good citirsen in Russell co Ky

Respectfuly
yours
capt Thomas wood
comanding Co G
Stat Com
B T

LENANON
OCT
4
KY
Gov Thomas E Bramlett
Frankfort Ky

Russell Cir Ct
vs
Wm Wood
2 judgts $60. each
Russell County Ct
vs
Wm E. Grider
Remit
Breach Peace
10th Oct 1865
